name: logitech-litra
title: Logitech Litra
description: Manage USB-connected Logitech Litra Glow and Logitech Litra Beam lights from Raycast
author: timrogers

commands.name: manage-devices
commands.title: Manage Devices
commands.subtitle: Turn on and off, and set brightness and temperature
commands.description: Turn your USB-connected Logitech Litra devices on or off, and set their brightness and temperature

commands.name: manage-temperature-presets
commands.title: Manage Temperature Presets
commands.subtitle: Set up presets for your Litra devices' temperature
commands.description: Configure presets so you can manage your Litra devices' temperature from Raycast

commands.name: manage-brightness-presets
commands.title: Manage Brightness Presets
commands.subtitle: Set up presets for your Litra devices' brightness
commands.description: Configure presets so you can manage your Litra devices' brightness from Raycast

preferences.name: cliDirectory
preferences.title: CLI directory
preferences.description: The path to the directory where the executable files from the `litra` npm package are installed. Install the CLI with `npm install -g litra`, then run `dirname $(which litra-on)` in your shell to find the correct path.

preferences.name: nodeBinaryPath
preferences.title: Node.js binary path
preferences.description: The path to the Node.js binary. If not specified, the `node` binary in your `PATH` will be used. You should only specify this if you get an error like `env: node: No such file or directory` when trying to use the extension. You can get the correct path by running `which node` in your shell.
